feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataplex
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataplex

entry.content: You can now use metadata change feeds to receive near real-time notifications about metadata changes in Dataplex. Dataplex publishes notifications to a Pub/Sub topic of your choice, letting you build event-driven workflows, sync metadata to external catalogs, or trigger data quality checks. For more information, see About metadata change feeds.
entry.summary: Dataplex now provides metadata change feeds, allowing you to receive near real-time notifications about metadata changes. These notifications are published to a Pub/Sub topic, enabling you to build event-driven workflows, sync metadata to external catalogs, or trigger data quality checks.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time metadata change notifications

entry.content: You can control data lineage ingestion for Dataproc at the organization, folder, or project level. This feature is in Preview. For more information, see Control lineage ingestion.
entry.summary: You can now control data lineage ingestion for Dataproc at the organization, folder, or project level. This feature is in Preview and offers granular control over lineage data. For more details, refer to the documentation on controlling lineage ingestion.
entry.title: Feature: Dataproc lineage ingestion control

entry.content: Some of the metadata that is stored in Dataplex Universal Catalog is changing. This change brings the metadata stored in Dataplex into consistency with metadata from the original source systems such as Vertex AI, Bigtable, Spanner, Pub/Sub, Dataform, and Dataproc Metastore. If you have workloads that depend on such Dataplex metadata, you must adjust them to preserve continuity. For more information about the scope of this change and what you need to do, see Changes to metadata stored in Dataplex Universal Catalog.
entry.summary: Metadata stored in Dataplex Universal Catalog is changing to align with source systems like Vertex AI and Bigtable. Workloads relying on this metadata may need adjustments to ensure continuity. Refer to the documentation for details on the scope and required actions.
entry.title: Breaking: Dataplex Catalog Metadata Update

entry.content:
Natural language search in Dataplex Universal Catalog is generally available (GA).

Natural language search extends keyword search to support natural language queries. It lets you find resources using everyday language, eliminating the need for complex syntax.
entry.summary: Dataplex Universal Catalog now supports natural language search, allowing users to find resources using everyday language instead of complex syntax.
entry.title: Feature: Natural language search now available in Dataplex

entry.content:
Data products in Dataplex Universal Catalog is now available in preview.

A data product serves as a logical, curated package of data assets designed to solve a specific business problem. It enables faster time to insights and provides trust, context, and self-service access request mechanisms for data consumers. For more information, see About data products.
entry.summary: Data products in Dataplex are now available in preview. Data products are curated packages of data assets that help solve business problems, providing faster insights and self-service access.
entry.title: Feature: Data products in Dataplex now in preview

entry.content:
Previously, data profile scan results were published only to the Google Cloud console. You can now publish the results of a data profile scan as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata. The latest results are saved to the entry that represents the source table. You can view the results in the Google Cloud console.

If you want to enable catalog publishing for an existing data profile scan, you must edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option.

For more information, see Use data profiling.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now publish data profile scan results as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata, with the latest results saved to the entry representing the source table. This provides a new way to access and view your data profiling information.
entry.title: Feature: Data Profile Scan Results Now Available as Catalog Metadata

entry.content: Column-level lineage is generally available (GA). The feature provides a granular view of your data by tracking the flow between individual columns within tables. You can perform functions such as root cause analysis, impact analysis, and data source verification for specific columns. Column-level lineage is only supported for BigQuery jobs. For more information about column-level lineage, see Column-level lineage.
entry.summary: Column-level lineage is now generally available for BigQuery jobs. This feature provides a granular view of your data by tracking the flow between individual columns within tables, enabling functions such as root cause analysis, impact analysis, and data source verification for specific columns.
entry.title: Feature: Column-level lineage now available

entry.content: You can now connect your Dataplex Universal Catalog instance to your favorite developer tools, such as the Gemini CLI and other IDEs. This integration enables AI-driven data discovery and asset management directly within your development environment. For more information, see Use Dataplex Universal Catalog with MCP, Gemini, and other agents.
entry.summary: Dataplex Universal Catalog can now be connected to your preferred developer tools like the Gemini CLI and IDEs, allowing for AI-driven data discovery and management within your development environment.
entry.title: Feature: Dataplex Universal Catalog Now Connects to Developer Tools

entry.content:
Natural language search in Dataplex Universal Catalog is available in preview.

Natural language search extends keyword search to support natural language queries. It lets you find resources using everyday language, eliminating the need for complex syntax.
entry.summary: Dataplex Universal Catalog now supports natural language search in preview. This feature allows you to find resources using everyday language, moving beyond traditional keyword searches.
entry.title: Feature: Natural language search available in Dataplex Universal Catalog

entry.content:
Previously, data quality scan results were published only to the Google Cloud console. You can now publish the results of a data quality scan as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata. The latest results are saved to the entry that represents the source table. You can view the results in the Google Cloud console.

If you want to enable catalog publishing for an existing data quality scan, you must edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option.

For more information, see Use auto data quality.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Data quality scan results can now be published as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata, with the latest results saved to the entry representing the source table. To enable this for existing scans, edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Data quality scan results now available in Dataplex Universal Catalog
